Body:
I'm in Mongolia trying to learn some Mongolian and I've come across their cute word for "litlle", "small": жижиг.

On previous trips through Turkey I recall learning a similar cute word for "little", "small": küçük.

I'm no fanboi of the Altaic Hypothesis but it's pretty accepted here and of course there is lots of contact between Mongolic and Turkic to allow loanwords by some route. Though I would've thought this would be core vocabulary not usually borrowed.
Title: Could Turkish "küçük" and Mongolian "жижиг" be related?

OwnerUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.
